args: After surviving the terrible fiends' ordeal,\nthe villagers ask Lea to train them in combat.
She obliges, and soon a special fiend-fighting\nunit begins to take shape under her command.
Stop! You are moving too far forward!\nYou must draw the fiend to you,\nTHEN press the attack!
We've another coming from the side.\nCan you immobilize it?
Perfect! Now keep them still and... Hah!
That is the last of them.
You all performed admirably, but there\nis still great room for improvement.
I shall center on those areas where you\nneed improvement when we return home.\nI pray you are ready for what is to come.
Lea's unit fought fiends across the continent.\nAs time passed, large numbers of people came\nto the Halidom to show their appreciation.
We were saved by Lea's Legion,\nso we were!
Seeing them fight filled us with courage.
We won't live a day longer in fear.\nThat's why we've come!
We're both capable archersâ€”and while\nwe've not battled against fiends before,\nwe want to join up with the Legion!
I'll talk to her and see what she says.
Lea's Legion sure is gettin' popular.\nWe got folks droppin' in here like\nwe're givin' away free mutton.
And we're getting people from every\nsocial class and walk of life.
The more they fight, the more other\npeople want to join them.
Then maybe it's time we formalized\nthis thing up proper.
That's not a bad idea, Ranzal.\nNot a bad idea at all...
Pray did I hear you correctly, Highness?\nYou wish to formally establish Lea's Legion\nas an official order of knights?
That's right. You'll be based out of this\ncastle and focus on slaying fiends.
Anyone will be able to join, irrespective\nof class and origin. Oh, and you will have\nmy full financial backing.
Best part is, yer gonna lead 'em!
I am honored you would ask such of me,\nbut do you truly think me up to the task?
I lost myself to anger not long ago;\nthat is hardly the emotional temperament\nthat befits a commander.
Looks like yer doin' just fine so far.
Actually, I think your rough edges make\nyou the perfect leader for this group.
The people who come here to fight have\nall faced hardship at the hands of fiends.
Many of them are driven by resentment.\nSome may even lose sight of themselves,\njust as you did earlier.
That makes you the perfect person\nto show them a better way.
But more importantly, these people\nare only here BECAUSE of you.
You filled them with courage just as your\nfather did, so it's only fair you teach them\nhow to walk that new path.
You're right. It falls to me to lead them\nin the right direction.
Great! Now let's get all the volunteers\ntogether for a big celebration!
We'll definitely need an inaugural address,\nso I hope you can prepare something.
I fear I am not much for public speaking.\nWhatever would I even say?
Tell them your vision for the new order;\nwhat you want Lea's Legion to become.
If you can't think of the perfect words to\nsay, just quote someone else's.
The perfect words for an ideal order...\nI have an idea.
Soon, the inauguration ceremony for the new\norder took place in the castle courtyard.
Lea looked out at the faces of her volunteers\nand spoke quietlyâ€”but with great conviction.

Someone who I deeply respect once
said something that stuck with me:
ï¼‚When a knight fights for others,
their sword stays behind.ï¼‚
As a child, I did not understand\nthe meaning of those words.
But meeting all of you here has finally\ngiven me that understanding.
One wields a sword to protect others.\nAnd in doing so, those who are protected\ngo on to become swords of their own.
Our battles will light the way for\nmany future guardians to come.

That's why we must never let our hearts
be filled with anger or sadness. Rather,
they must shine with prideâ€”as well as
the conviction to do what is right.
I shall make this an order that each\nof you will be proud to fight for.
An order whose name is known across\nthe land for its good deeds.
Hooray for the commander!\nHooray for Lea's Legion!
I'm looking forward to this, Lea.\nYou're going to do great things.
I shall never let you down, Highness.
My knights will know only victory,\nand I will see the seeds of my\nfather's courage blossom in full!
